comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; pl; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; pl; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

When downloading a file over 100 MB large (eg. gparted-live-0.8.0-1.iso) download manager (the default one) displays 99.8 of X MB, then 99.9 of X MB, then 100.0 of X MB and then promptly after that 100 of X MB. I find it strange that 100.0 is displayed.

Reproducible: Didn't try




I got some add-ons installed with Download Statusbar among them. 
And btw.: Component/File Handling says "This component does not cover: (...) the Download Manager which has its own component in the Toolkit product." so which Component category in this form should I choose (or "have I chosen" - excuse my english) for this report?
comments.creator: werni@go2.pl

When downloading a file over 100 MB large (eg. gparted-live-0.8.0-1.iso) download manager (the default one) displays 99.8 of X MB, then 99.9 of X MB, then 100.0 of X MB and then promptly after that 100 of X MB. I find it strange that 100.0 is displayed.
